subject: Re: [junit] How to test XML file processing?

You might start by refactoring your code to separate the file
processing from the XML processing. This way you can more easily
unit-test the XML processing without having to generate or maintain a
test file to pass to your current method.

Regards,
allan


----- Original Message -----
From: jxingtang <jxingtang@...>
Date: Mon, 16 Aug 2004 03:52:35 -0000
Subject: [junit] How to test XML file processing?
To: junit@yahoogroups.com

 I have a method to read an XML file and then use DOM to extract the 
 data. Can anyone recommend a good way to unit test this method? The 
 code snippet is blow:
 
       public void processConfigFile( String fileNameArg )
             throws IllegalArgumentException
       {
             File configFile = new File( fileNameArg );
             if( configFile.exists() == false )
             {
                   String msg = "Failed to locate the specified 
 configuration file \"" +
                                     fileNameArg + "\"";
                   throw new IllegalArgumentException( msg );
             }
             
             DocumentBuilderFactory factory =
                   DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
             
             try 
             {
                DocumentBuilder builder = 
 factory.newDocumentBuilder();
                configDoc = builder.parse( configFile );
             }
                 ....
